Detailed Description

The core console input/output class.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum CrissCross::IO::CoreConsole::ColourTypes

Flags used for describing console colour output.

Enumerator:
FG_BLUE  Blue Foreground
FG_GREEN  Green Foreground
FG_RED  Red Foreground
FG_INTENSITY  Foreground intensity (makes the foreground colour a shade brighter)
BG_BLUE  Blue Background
BG_GREEN  Green Background
BG_RED  Red Background
BG_INTENSITY  Background intensity (makes the foreground colour a shade brighter)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CrissCross::IO::CoreConsole::CoreConsole (  ) 

The default constructor.

Allocates a new console (in Windows) for stdout and stderr output.

CrissCross::IO::CoreConsole::CoreConsole ( FILE *  _outputBuffer  ) 

The alternate constructor.

Does not allocate a new console, and instead uses the specified FILE * for output.

Parameters:
_outputBuffer The destination buffer for CoreConsole output.
See also:
CoreConsole()

CrissCross::IO::CoreConsole::~CoreConsole (  ) 

The destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void CrissCross::IO::CoreConsole::Clear (  ) 

Clears the console.

Clears the console output (similar to commands 'cls' on Windows and 'clear' on Linux).

void CrissCross::IO::CoreConsole::MoveUp ( int  _lines  ) 

Move up a line.

Permits you to overwrite the previous line. Good for a status display.

void CrissCross::IO::CoreConsole::SetColour ( short  _flags  ) 

Sets the console output colour.

Sets the console output colour using the flags specified in _flags.

Parameters:
_flags A bitmask created by OR-ing CoreConsole::ColourTypes flags.
